name: Kirkstall Abbey
summary: Ruins of a Cistercian monastery beside the River Aire in Leeds.
description: Founded in 1152, the abbey grew into a major Cistercian house before dissolution in 1539. Its soaring nave, cloister and chapter house remain remarkably intact, offering a powerful glimpse of medieval monastic life.
highlights: Abbey House Museum across the road

getting_there: Bus routes from Leeds city centre
